autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.candidate_finder module¶

autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.candidate_finder.demangle_many(symbols)[source]¶

The names of these symbols, run through a c++ demangler

Warning:this calls out to the external program c++filt and will fail loudly if it’s not installed
Parameters:symbols (list) – list of tuples of address/symbol pairs
Returns:demangled names
Return type:list[str]
autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.candidate_finder.get_candidate_callsites_from_csv(app, csv_path)[source]¶

Finds the addresses of all candidate callsites based on the csv generated by CFI Assessor

Parameters:
  • app (angr.Project) – application the callsites should be found in
  • csv_path (str) – path to the CFI assessor callsite csv file
Returns:

list of candidate functions containing callsites, described by their vtable address, Symbol in app, and address of the callsite itself
Return type:

list[(int, angr.Symbol, int)]
autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.candidate_finder.get_candidate_gadgets_from_csv(app, csv_path)[source]¶

Finds the addresses of all candidate gadgets based on the info in the csv file generated by CFI assessor

Parameters:
  • app (angr.Project) – application the gadgets should be found in
  • csv_path (str) – path to the CFI assessor candidate gadget csv file
Returns:

list of candidate gadgets, described by their vtable address and Symbol in app
Return type:

list[(int, angr.Symbol)]
autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.candidate_finder.get_candidate_gadgets_from_line(app, line)[source]¶

Finds the addresses of all candidate gadgets based on the info in the csv file generated by CFI assessor

Parameters:
  • app (angr.Project) – application the gadgets should be found in
  • line (list[str]) – a line from the csv file describing calltargets
Returns:

list of candidate gadgets, described by their vtable address and Symbol in app
Return type:

list[(int, angr.Symbol)]

autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.candidate_finder.get_symbol_for_address(app, address)[source]¶

Gets the symbol corresponding to an address. If no symbol exactly matches the address, the symbol with the next smaller address is returned.

Parameters:
  • app (angr.Project) – application the symbol should be found in
  • address (int) – address to be searched for
Returns:

Symbol object with (roughly) matching address

  • name (str) – demangled name to be found
Returns:

Symbol object with matching demangled name

classmethod is_candidate_function(app, candidate)[source]¶

Semantic filtering based on disassembly, using only the gadget category, but no information like register assignments or concrete variable values.

Parameters:
  • app – Parent angr project
  • candidate – A candidate gadget
Returns:

True if gadget is valid gadget for this category
Return type:

bool
classmethod is_candidate_gadget(app, candidate, call)[source]¶

Semantic filtering based on disassembly, using information that is only known at runtime like register assignments.

Parameters:
  • app – Parent angr project
  • candidate – A candidate gadget
  • call – The concrete gadget
Returns:

True if gadget is valid gadget for this category
Return type:

bool
name = 'DEFAULT'¶
search()[source]¶

Searches through the candidate set for valid gadgets and generates the gadget objects. This function should not be modified, instead modify the functions called by search.

Yields:Gadget addresses and builder objects
setup_state(gadget_symbol, vtable_addr)[source]¶

  • vtable_addr – Vtable address of gadget

autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.solver_utils module¶

class autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.solver_utils.CheckUniquenessAndFind(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: angr.exploration_techniques.explorer.Explorer

Exploration technique for the angr simulation manager that searches for some addresses, avoiding some other addresses, without visiting the same block twice. The latter condition is to avoid loops.

Parameters:
  • find (list[int]) – find these addresses
  • avoid (list[int]) – avoid these addresses
filter(simgr, state, *args)[source]¶

Perform filtering on a state.

If the state should not be filtered, return None. If the state should be filtered, return the name of the stash to move the state to. If you want to modify the state before filtering it, return a tuple of the stash to move the state to and the modified state.

class autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.solver_utils.CheckUniquenessAndReturn[source]¶

Bases: angr.exploration_techniques.ExplorationTechnique

Exploration technique for angr simulation manager that searches for a return from the starting function, without visiting the same block twice.

filter(simgr, state, *args)[source]¶

Perform filtering on a state.

If the state should not be filtered, return None. If the state should be filtered, return the name of the stash to move the state to. If you want to modify the state before filtering it, return a tuple of the stash to move the state to and the modified state.

autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.solver_utils.ensure_args(state, args)[source]¶

Adds constraints to make sure that the values for the arguments have been loaded to the correct registers

Parameters:
  • state – state of the app after the gadget has been run. Constraints will be added to this object.
  • args (list[Variable]) – arguments that have to be loaded

Todo

Allow for more than one argument to be passed.

Todo

Different strategies depending on operating system.

Ensures that all asserts following the gadget asserts are true.

Parameters:
  • state – state to add conditions to
  • gadget – gadget to ensure postconditions of
autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.solver_utils.ensure_preconditions(state, gadget)[source]¶

Ensures that all preconditions (register and memory assignments) are met

Parameters:
  • state – state to add conditions to
  • gadget – gadget to ensure preconditions of

Adds constraints to check that the vptr points to the correct vtable

Parameters:
  • state – state of the app after the gadget has been run. Constaints will be added to this object.
  • vtable_addr (int) – address of the vtable
  • self_ptr (int) – address of the start of the object

autocoop.esl_lib.lib_utils.solver_utils.resolve_reg(register)[source]¶

Changes a platform independant register id (_r1, _r2, …) into a platform specific one (rdi, rsi, …)

Parameters:register (str) – register to translate
Returns:platform specific register id
